title: Lesson 4
paragraph: Learning requires understanding and insight. Comprehending, interpreting, and synthesizing information allows individuals to make better decisions and gain knowledge effectively.

words.example: She comprehended the complex theory easily.
He could discern subtle differences in the design.

words.meaning: to draw a conclusion from evidence
words.example: From the clues, she deduced the answer.
He interpreted the poem in his own way.

words.meaning: to judge the value or quality
words.example: The teacher evaluated the students’ essays.
We inferred her mood from her expression.
The professor illuminated the concept for students.
He grasped the main idea quickly.

words.meaning: to combine ideas into a coherent whole
words.example: She synthesized information from various sources.
The lecturer elucidated the difficult concept.
